title: 20 students fall ill due to suspected water contamination at Neravada
content: Of the 20, four are being treated at the Government Hospital in Panyam, while the remaining students were provided medical care at the Tribal Boys Residential School hostel itself

title: Supreme Court to hear Justice Yashwant Varma’s petition against in-house committee report on July 28
content: CJI B.R. Gavai’s willingness to judicially examine the question of Justice Varma’s removal comes days after the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha members initiated a removal motion and submitted notices on the same

title: Govindachamy alleges drug, liquor trade inside Kannur Central Jail
content: He says he got no help in the jailbreak, admits to smoking ganja-laced beedi on the eve of the escape

title: Tamil Nadu Green Energy Corporation applies for intra-State electricity trading licence
content: It will engage in power trading through medium- and long-term contracts with simultaneous power purchase agreement and power sale agreement with the renewable power developer and Tamil Nadu Power Distribution Corporation Limited respectively

title: Shipbuilding cluster at Dugarajapatnam to give fillip to A.P.’s maritime sector
content: Currently, most of the commercial shipbuilding and repairs in the world are being done by the Japanese and Koreans, with companies such as Imabari Shipbuilding Co. Ltd, Hyundai and Kawasaki Shipbuilding Corporation being the dominant players

title: Guarantee schemes improved people’s purchasing power, helped Karnataka topper capita income, says CM Siddaramaiah
content: CM Siddaramaiah, DCM D.K. Shivakumar inaugurates and lays foundation stones for development works in Arasikere constituency of Hassan district

title: Consistent effort key to India’s growth in space technology, says ISRO chairman
content: the upcoming NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar (NISAR) mission on July 30 was testimony to India’s growing stature in space technology, says V. Narayanan

title: PM Modi departs for home after concluding visit to Maldives
content: Earlier, Prime Minister Narenddra Modi was warmly welcomed at the iconic Republic Square, where he graced the Independence Day celebrations of the Maldives as the guest of honour.

title: Kerala needs to support transplant patients for immunosuppressive therapy
content: As families with limited means are unable to bear the huge financial cost of post-transplant care, the State government must step in with financial support. Non-adherence to immunosuppressive therapy is becoming the single most cause of poor transplant outcome and organ rejection, say experts.

title: Governor approves ₹5,000 crore KKRDB action plan for 2025–26
content: Jewargi MLA and KKRDB chairperson Ajay Singh, who released a press note on Thursday, said the approval came in the third week of July after Chief Minister Siddaramaiah submitted the plan for the Governor’s assent

title: Officials directed to upgrade infrastructure in tribal welfare hostels in Annammaya district
content: All pending works in hostels and classrooms must be completed with quality and within the stipulated timeframe, says Collector

title: Keep politics out of ‘Hari Hara Veera Mallu’, say Pawan Kalyan fans and JSP leaders
content: Jana Sena Party leaders distribute sarees to theatre staff as goodwill gesture; urge social media users and rival parties to stop spreading negativity about the film

title: Crime rate in Satya Sai district down by 27%, says SP
content: A Command and Control Room will be set up in Kadiri sub-division soon, as the region is known for frequent incidence of crimes against women and children, says SP

title: A.P. CM to leave for Singapore on July 26 night
content: A high-level delegation led by the Chief Minister will be on a five-day tour to attract investment to the State

title: Foreign medical graduates working in Telangana demand equal pay and recognition
content: Representation made on behalf of FMG interns highlights how these medicos, who cleared the mandatory Foreign Medical Graduate Examination, are being pushed to the margins despite their contribution to the State’s healthcare system

title: Inner Ring Road street project revamps one of Bengaluru’s busiest corridors with data-led, citizen-driven mobility improvements
content: According to the report, prior to intervention, the IRR corridor was plagued with congestion, missing footpaths, unlit stretches, poorly maintained stormwater drains, and inadequate bus frequency

title: Contaminated medicines killed 1,300 people in 90 years: WHO-UNODC report
content: The health of countless patients, predominantly children, had been compromised by the ingestion of medicines with dangerously high levels of toxic chemicals, the report said

title: PM Modi joins Maldives’ Independence Day celebrations as chief guest
content: PM Modi warmly welcomed in Maldives for Independence Day celebrations at Republic Square as guest of honour

title: Affair & poisoning: How missing bottle cap exposed 'suicide' as murder; wife, lover held
content: Initially appearing as a suicide near Kanva dam, the death of Lokesh Kumar, a former gram panchayat president, was cleverly disguised. However, observant police officers noticed missing details like the poison bottle cap and a missing slipper, raising suspicions.

title: India-US trade deal: Piyush Goyal shares important update on negotiations
content: Commerce minister Piyush Goyal announced that trade agreement talks with the US are progressing rapidly, with the next negotiation round scheduled for August in India. Both nations aim to finalize the initial agreement tranche by fall, targeting a significant boost to bilateral trade from $191 billion to $500 billion.

title: JD Vance on Al taking jobs: If robots are coming for our jobs, you would...
content: US Vice President JD Vance dismisses fears of AI-driven mass unemployment, asserting that current labor market trends don't support such claims. Speaking at the AI Action Summit in Paris, Vance argued that AI will augment human labor, boosting productivity and creating new job opportunities.

title: 'Ashamed to support Bihar govt': Chirag Paswan flays NDA ally Nitish over rising crime
content: LJP (Ram Vilas) chief Chirag Paswan has criticized Bihar CM Nitish Kumar over the state's deteriorating law and order situation, even while his party remains a part of the NDA. Paswan's remarks follow a series of high-profile crimes in Bihar, leading the opposition to highlight potential rifts within the ruling alliance.

title: Elon Musk's Neuralink implants brain chip in ninth patient
content: Elon Musk's Neuralink has achieved a milestone by implanting its brain chip in a ninth human, following the first trial in January 2024. The device translates brain signals, enabling users to control devices with their thoughts, initially aiding paralyzed individuals. Neuralink aims to bridge humans and AI, potentially unlocking advanced cognitive abilities.

title: Cops bust int'l cartel run on delivery app model; gang used women as carriers
content: Delhi Police cracked down on a significant drug trafficking operation. They seized drugs worth over Rs 100 crore. Five foreign nationals got arrested. The syndicate operated across multiple countries. It used encrypted channels and forged documents. The police recovered cocaine, MDMA, and OG ganja. The investigation revealed a complex money laundering scheme. Authorities are further investigating the network.

title: Easier path to Green Card? US lawmaker to table bill in Senate soon - but will it pass?
content: Senator Alex Padilla is set to introduce a bill offering a green card pathway to immigrants who have resided in the US for at least seven years, have no criminal record, and meet other requirements. This initiative aims to update the Immigration and Nationality Act, potentially benefiting over 8 million people, including Dreamers and skilled workers facing green card backlogs.

title: Mumbai mishap: Car plunges into ditch after driver follows Google Maps; rescued
content: In Navi Mumbai's Belapur, a woman driving an Audi was rescued early Friday after her car plunged into a ditch around 1:00 am. She was reportedly following Google Maps directions when she took a wrong turn under a bridge, leading her into the water.

title: Jeff Bezos sells $1.5 billion worth of Amazon shares, holds stock valued at...
content: Jeff Bezos recently sold 6.6 million Amazon shares worth $1.5 billion, as per an SEC filing. The sales occurred on July 21 and 22, before Amazon's Q2 earnings report. These transactions were executed under a prearranged 10b5-1 trading plan. Bezos intends to sell more shares, potentially up to 25 million by May 2026. He has already sold $4.

title: Top 5 entertainment news of the day: Hera Pheri 3 back on track & more
content: Sandeep Reddy Vanga regrets cutting emotional scenes from 'Animal,' while Akshay Kumar confirms 'Hera Pheri 3' is back with the original cast. Ekta Kapoor distances herself from the banned OTT platform ALTT, clarifying her departure in 2021. Amidst Saiyaara’s success, Aneet Padda denies nepotism claims, and Farah Khan seemingly critiques Deepika Padukone's demand for shorter work shifts.

title: Low insurance costs, affordable treatment and medicines drawing NRIs to India
content: A Policybazaar report reveals a surge in NRIs seeking medical treatment in India, driven by significantly lower costs. Health insurance purchases by NRIs have jumped 150% in 2024-25. Treatment costs in India can be 60-90% less than in the US, with heart bypass surgery costing Rs 4.5-8 lakh compared to Rs 60 lakh-1.3 crore in the US.

title: Bihar: Woman faints during home guard recruitment drive; 'gang-raped' inside ambulance
content: A shocking incident occurred in Gaya district, Bihar. A 26-year-old woman reported a gang-rape. The crime allegedly happened in a moving ambulance. She collapsed during a Home Guard recruitment drive. The incident took place on July 24th. Police arrested two men swiftly after receiving the complaint. An investigation is currently underway.

title: Michael Pezzetta wins over Maple Leafs fans with surprise visit to Youth Hockey camp
content: Michael Pezzetta, a Toronto native, has signed a two-year, $1.625 million deal with the Maple Leafs, adding physicality to their bottom-six. He recently engaged with young fans at the Maple Leafs youth hockey camp, demonstrating his commitment to the community. Pezzetta's return home brings excitement to his family and friends, all avid Leafs supporters.

title: Josh Allen reacts: Sister’s baby line drops with No. 17 twist — Bills fans gush online
content: Josh Allen's sister, Nicala Madden, launched a baby clothing line called Little Dreamers Co., featuring a special collection named "17 Sideline Snuggles" as a tribute to Allen's jersey number. The Buffalo Bills quarterback expressed his pride and support for his sister's new venture.

title: Asia Cup 2025 schedule: Complete fixtures, India vs Pakistan date out
content: The 2025 Asia Cup is officially scheduled to take place in the United Arab Emirates from September 9th to 28th. The announcement was made by the Pakistan Cricket Board chairman on social media, promising a 'spectacular display of cricket'. Cricket enthusiasts can anticipate the release of the detailed schedule, including specific venues and fixtures, in the near future.

title: Uttarakhand: Landslide blocks Kedarnath route near Gaurikund; pilgrims halted
content: The trekking route to Kedarnath Dham, near Gaurikund, has been closed due to a landslide triggered by a hillock collapse on Friday night. The Public Works Department is working to clear the debris and restore the path. Security personnel are assisting pilgrims returning from Kedarnath, while those heading towards the shrine from Gaurikund have been stopped.

title: Prada-Kolhapuri row: Piyush Goyal says India will get due credit for its design
content: Union Minister Piyush Goyal announced that India will receive due recognition for its unique cultural products under the new FTA with the UK, citing the Prada-Kolhapuri chappal controversy. The government aims to protect and promote Indian GI products in global markets, with potential for significant international business.

title: Piyush Goyal lauds India-UK FTA; calls it 'stepping stone towards Viksit Bharat'
content: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal hailed the newly signed India-UK FTA as a "game-changing" agreement, offering significant opportunities for Indian farmers, businesses, and youth. The comprehensive FTA, awaiting UK Parliamentary approval, aims to eliminate duties on 99% of Indian exports to the UK.

title: 'Manifests savarn and shudras': MP HC flags 'caste system' in judiciary
content: ​​The court also criticised what it described as a "caste system" within the judicial setup, where high court judges are seen as "savarn" and district judges as "shudras" and "les misérables."

title: IND vs ENG: Jagadeesan gets visa, will leave tomorrow as Pant's injury cover
content: Narayan Jagadeesan is set to join the India squad in England as cover for the injured Rishabh Pant, who fractured his toe. Despite competition from other players, Jagadeesan's consistent performance and strong mental fortitude earned him the call-up. His coach highlights his discipline and process-oriented approach, while the Indian team grapples with multiple injury concerns during the ongoing tour.

title: 'Saiyaara’ BO collection day 9 (Live): Mohit Suri’s film set to cross Rs 200cr?
content: Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara,' starring newcomers Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, is a box office sensation, poised to cross Rs 200 crore on its second Saturday. The film's strong emotional narrative and music have resonated with audiences, propelling it into the Top 50 Hindi films. Akshay Kumar praised the film, highlighting the success of fresh talent in Bollywood.

title: EU sanctions on Russia oil: Indian arm of UAE-based shipping company takes a hit
content: The EU has imposed sanctions on Intershipping Services Hub, an Indian subsidiary of a UAE-based firm, and Captain Abhinav Kamal for allegedly aiding Russian oil trade. These sanctions, limited to EU entities, freeze European assets and restrict business dealings.

title: Mohit Suri’s ‘Saiyaara’ becomes 2025’s second-biggest hit, beats 'Housefull 5'
content: Mohit Suri's Saiyaara is a box office hit. The film stars Ahaan Pandya and Aneet Padda. Saiyaara has earned Rs 190.25 crore in just eight days. It surpassed Housefull 5 collections. Experts predict a Rs 250 crore lifetime run. The film's success continues due to postponed releases. Saiyaara's second Friday earned Rs 17.50 crore.

title: 'Forever indebted': Tributes pour in from cricketers, IPL teams on Kargil Vijay Diwas
content: India commemorated the anniversary of Kargil Vijay Diwas, honouring the Indian armed forces' bravery and victory in the 1999 Kargil War. Former cricketers like Sachin Tendulkar and VVS Laxman, along with IPL teams such as Chennai Super Kings and Mumbai Indians, paid tribute to the soldiers' sacrifices on social media.

title: Kiss cam scandal: Astronomer teams up with Chris Martin's ex-wife Gwyneth Paltrow
content: Following a viral kiss cam incident involving its CEO and HR head at a Coldplay concert, tech company Astronomer has hired Gwyneth Paltrow as a temporary spokesperson. Paltrow's appearance in a promotional video aims to deflect attention from the scandal with humor. The company hopes to leverage the unexpected publicity, despite mixed reactions to the PR stunt.

title: Happy Hariyali Teej 2025 top 50 wishes, messages, and quotes
content: Hariyali Teej is a beautiful reminder of resilience, devotion, and the power of love. To honour the sacred bond of Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati, fill your day with captivating messages, wishes, and quotes that spread joy, love, and sheer blessings.

title: ‘OBCs will have to think ...’: Cong leader likens Rahul to Ambedkar; BJP slams comparison
content: The BJP has intensified its criticism of Congress following Udit Raj's statement suggesting Rahul Gandhi could become a "second Ambedkar" with OBC support. Amit Malviya accused Congress of plotting to diminish Ambedkar's legacy, while Rahul Gandhi acknowledged his past failure to protect the OBC community and pledged to rectify it with a caste census.

title: 'Teams win because of combinations, not ...': Sidhu slams Gambhir's tactics
content: Former cricketer Navjot Singh Sidhu has strongly criticised Gautam Gambhir's team selection strategy during the ongoing Test series against England, particularly in the fourth Test. Sidhu expressed frustration over the frequent changes in the team composition, which he believes has disrupted the team's rhythm and hindered their ability to perform collectively.

title: India-UK trade deal: States, sectors set to gain from tariff cuts- see list
content: India and the UK are signing a trade agreement. This deal will remove tariffs and make trade easier. Maharashtra will export more engineering goods and medicines. Gujarat will see growth in pharma and seafood exports. Tamil Nadu's textile and leather industries will benefit. Other states like Andhra Pradesh and Punjab will also experience export growth.

title: Cambodia calls for immediate ceasefire with Thailand; 13 killed in border clashes
content: Cambodia urged an immediate ceasefire with Thailand following two days of intense cross-border conflict. The clashes occurred near the Preah Vihear and Prasat Ta Muen Thom temples. Both nations exchanged rockets and artillery fire. The United Nations Security Council addressed the situation. Casualties included soldiers and civilians on both sides.

title: ‘We are underpaid’: Stephen Curry sparks salary debate
content: Stephen Curry ignited a debate about NBA player compensation by suggesting that stars are underpaid relative to the league's soaring valuations. He argued that the current CBA structure prevents players from participating in equity, limiting their potential earnings. Curry believes players deserve a share in the league's financial success, advocating for changes to the CBA.

title: Democratic Leader Approval Ratings: PM Modi tops global list again; where does Trump rank?
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi continues to be the most popular global leader, securing a 75% approval rating according to Morning Consult's latest data from July 4-10, 2025. He is followed by South Korean President Lee Jae Myung and Argentina's Javier Milei.

title: Maharashtra horror: HIV+ girl raped for 2 years by care-home staffer; forced to abort
content: Latur police are investigating a harrowing case involving a 16-year-old HIV positive girl who alleges repeated rape by a staffer at her residential facility over two years. She was also forced to undergo an abortion. The facility's director, his wife, and another staffer have been arrested for allegedly suppressing the matter.

title: WATCH: Bumrah's staircase stumble triggers major injury scare for India
content: India faced injury concerns on Day 3 of the fourth Test as Jasprit Bumrah appeared to hurt his ankle, while Mohammed Siraj also struggled with discomfort. England capitalised, with Joe Root's magnificent 150 propelling them to a commanding 544/7, establishing a substantial 186-run lead. Ben Stokes remained unbeaten, steering England towards a potential series-clinching victory.

title: 'Missed important meeting': Air India flyers spend 2 hours in plane after taxiing
content: An Air India flight (AI-2982) from Delhi to Pune experienced a technical issue on Friday, causing significant delays for its 150 passengers. After taxiing, the Airbus A-320 returned to the bay, leaving passengers waiting anxiously for two hours. Passengers expressed frustration over the lack of communication and missed business meetings.

title: IND v ENG | Weather Updates: Will rain hurt India's chances on Day 4?
content: The weather forecast for Day 4 of the crucial India vs England fourth Test at Old Trafford predicts light rain in the morning, potentially impacting India's batting performance as they trail in the series.

title: ITC announces Rs 20,000cr investment push: Focus on FMCG margin boost
content: ITC Ltd. is set to invest Rs 20,000 crore across its diverse business sectors over the next five to six years, following the inauguration of eight new manufacturing facilities. The company, having already invested ₹4,500 crore in capex over the last two years, is also eyeing potential acquisitions to bolster growth.

title: Palaniswami, Dhinakaran express shock over death of policeman who was assaulted in Chennai
content: Rajaraman, a special sub-inspector of police, was assaulted on July 18 and died without responding to treatment eight days later

title: Sexual harassment at workplace often takes suble forms, says Justice Anitha Sumanth
content: There are times when we may not be able to identify a particular act as harassment but we do know that it makes us uncomfortable, says the High Court Judge

title: Tech adoption key to better healthcare delivery, says Vizianagaram DMHO
content: Jeevan Rani stresses the role of trained paramedics and innovation at Centurion University’s international conference

title: Heavy rain forecast: Vizianagaram Joint Collector directs officials to stay alert
content: He stresses the importance of coordination among departments to effectively manage any eventualities during the current rainy season

title: Let us provide children with a nurturing environment, says judge at book launch on child protection laws in Ballari
content: Children are akin to divine beings. We must provide a safe and nurturing environment in houses, schools, and neighbourhoods to help them thrive., says judge

title: Alappuzha MCH to launch Palliative Care Clinic with Living Will Information Desk
content: Living Will Information Desk has been setup to document a person’s medical treatment preferences in advance

title: Enforcement Directorate raids against Anil Ambani Group companies continue on day 3
content: Enforcement Directorate raids Reliance Group companies in Mumbai in connection with Rs 3,000 crore bank loan fraud case

title: Heavy rainfall: Outflow increased from Almatti dam
content: Following heavy rainfall in the Koyna dam’s catchement area in Maharashtra, the authorities have issued an alert informing about increased discharge into the Koyna river

title: Error-ridden draft voters’ list published on July 23, alleges Opposition Leader V.D. Satheesan
content: Satheesan saysid the names of several voters who had exercised their franchise in the last local body elections were missing in the draft rolls.

title: Scheduled Tribe panel notice to Rajasthan government over school roof collapse deaths
content: Commission seeks detailed report and action taken within three days; several victims belonged to SC/ST communities

title: Lack of birth control centres, shortage of vets, leads to spike in dog bites, rabies deaths across south India
content: Across the South, there has been a significant increase in dog bites and rabies deaths over the past three years; experts have called for a more coordinated, widespread response, involving better infrastructure, a larger number of trained veterinarians, and faster decision-making to address the issue comprehensively

title: India took less than 22 minutes in taking Pulwama revenge: Adityanath at Vijay Diwas event
content: “We do not lack warriors, glory, or intellect, but at that time, some individuals divided the country for their interests, leading to its enslavement,” the Uttar Pradesh CM said

title: Behind the 7/11 acquittals, a legal cell which worked quietly and tirelessly for 19 years
content: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind legal cell secures acquittal for 12 accused in Mumbai blasts, calls for accountability of investigating agencies

title: Kochi city pounded by heavy rain on Saturday; amid high tide, situation along Ernakulam’s coastal belt worsens
content: The city saw its worst flood situation since the onset of monsoon on May 24. Areas near the KSRTC bus stand and Ernakulam South railway station, and many major roads left flooded

title: Bus operators seek action against illegal parking along Kozhikode-Kuttiyadi route
content: They allege that the merchants and auditorium owners are responsible for creating moving bottlenecks on the accident-prone route

title: Peace and normalcy returning to Manipur, says Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla
content: Mr. Bhalla was speaking at an event in Imphal organised to commemorate the 26th anniversary of Kargil Vijay Diwas.

title: Any of the 11 documents accepted for SIR verification are susceptible to falsification: petitioner counters EC in Supreme Court
content: The Election Commission had refused to accept Aadhaar, Voter ID, and ration card for the Bihar SIR on the grounds that they were prone to fraud

title: Sankara Nethralaya pays tribute to Dr. Namperumalsamy
content: ‘Dr. Nam’, as he was fondly known, was chairman-emeritus of Madurai-based Aravind Eye Hospital. He died on Thursday (July 25, 2025) at the age of 85

title: Kerala HC directs police to train personnel and equip them for using e-Sakshya or other platforms to document crime scenes
content: e-Sakshya assists the police in recording crime scenes, searches, and seizures, and to upload them to a cloud-based platform

title: T.N. government may start land acquisition for Hosur airport in three months
content: The consultant hired by the State government has submitted the Obstacle Limitation Surfaces (OLS) survey for two sites identified recently, and the administration is expected to finalise the location within a month and a half

title: KLE Society’s contribution to Belagavi immense: Minister Laxmi Hebbalkar
content: Minister for Women and Child Development Laxmi Hebbalkar has said that contribution of KLE Society to the growth of Belagavi was immense and because of it Belagavi was shining on the world map.

title: Government should focus on re-enrollment of dropout students: APTF
content: Bankuru Joginaidu said that the parents who joined their kids in private schools would again send them back to government schools if steps were taken to appoint at least two teachers for each school.

title: CM Siddaramaiah says Congress developed Mysuru more than the BJP
content: The CM maintained that during the Congress party rule, the government did much development work in Mysuru. However, the BJP government did not develop Mysuru when they were in power.

title: Rain triggers a trail of destruction in Kerala; train services halted at Alappuzha; yellow alert for 9 districts on Sunday
content: Train traffic to Ernakulam from Thiruvananthapuram via Alappuzha disrupted for about two hours after tree fell reported near Mararikulam at 8.30 a.m.

title: Andhra’s first commercially-licensed mini theatre thrown open near Rajamahendravaram
content: Collaborated with Qube cinema, the 20-seat capacity theatre is exclusively meant for families and group of audience at a government-fixed ticket cost

title: Two-member special team headed by former HC judge to probe Govindachamy’s jailbreak
content: A comprehensive investigation will be conducted by a special team headed by former Kerala High Court Judge Justice Retd. C.N. Ramachandran Nair and former State police chief Jacob Punnoose

title: India-U.K. free trade agreement ‘game-changing’, every section to benefit, says Piyush Goyal
content: India-U.K. Free Trade Agreement (FTA) was signed by Mr. Goyal and his counterpart Jonathan Reynolds in the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and British Prime Minister Keir Starmer

title: Bihar Military Police aspirant alleges gang-rape in ambulance en route to hospital in Bihar
content: Two persons arrested in Bodh Gaya; SIT formed to probe incident; Opposition targets Nitish Kumar government over law and order

title: Gujarat Congress camp: Rahul Gandhi blames ‘biased umpire’ ECI for poll defeats; slams BJP-RSS ‘control’
content: Rahul Gandhi assured the district unit chiefs of his party in Gujarat that their opinions will be taken into account while selecting poll candidates

title: Applications invited for JRF posts by Lakireddy Hanimireddy Degree College at Mylavaram
content: In a statement, project Director J. Ramudu said the candidates must have completed M.Sc in Botany/Plant Sciences/Plant Biotechnology

title: Flood alert in Chintoor Agency as water level on the rise in Godavari
content: The relief camps will be opened only after the first flood warning at Bhadrachalam in Telangana State

title: CM Naidu congratulates Ashok Gajapathi Raju on being sworn in as Goa Governor
content: AP CM N. Chandrababu Naidu expressed confidence that Mr. Gajapathi Raju would carry out his new responsibilities with the same dedication and impartiality and stand as an example to others

title: 17 MPs honoured with Sansad Ratna Awards for Parliamentary performance
content: The honours also include four Special Jury Awards, recognising their consistent contributions to parliamentary democracy across three successive terms

title: Maoist SZCM, East Bastar division in-charge Nagaraju, his wife Aruna surrendered before DGP Harish Kumar Gupta
content: “The couple is involved in several cases and carries a reward of ₹20 lakh and ₹5 lakh respectively,” says DGP Harish Kumar Gupta

title: Ashok Gajapathi Raju takes oath as Goa Governor
content: Former Union Minister Ashok Gajapathi Raju sworn in as Governor of Goa, succeeding P.S. Sreedharan Pillai, vows to serve people

title: CAG data indicates Andhra Pradesh’s worsened fiscal stress: Jagan
content: It is quite apparent that the economic buoyancy of the State is lost, as evident from the abysmally low growth across some categories of State Government revenues and negative growth in others, says Former CM Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy

title: Telangana Weather July 27 |  Thunderstorm alert in 25  districts
content: Meanwhile, Hyderabad and its surrounding areas, for the next 24 hours will see a generally cloudy sky.

title: Gusty winds hit rural areas of Kozhikode district
content: Several houses have been damaged in Nadapuram, Thiruvambai, Mukkom and Koodaranhi areas apart from disrupting the power supply

title: IMD predicts heavy rainfall in Mumbai, suburbs; red alert issued for Palghar
content: The IMD stated that heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely in the island city and suburbs till July 27 morning, with the possibility of occasional gusty winds reaching 40-50 kmph

title: Frequent disruptions in Parliament harm Opposition more than government: Kiren Rijiju
content: Negative news drives TRPs, not constructive action. It is a vicious cycle — both the MPs and the media are trapped in it, says Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju

title: Tender process for Arebetta crossing station in final stages, SWR tells MP Kota Srinivas Poojary
content: The crossing station on Subrahmanya Road-Sakleshpur Ghat section enhances train-handling capacity through the ghat

title: Search operations launched at Rajasthan CMO, Jaipur airport after bomb threat via email
content: "The anti-bomb squad, police, fire brigade and civil defence teams were swiftly deployed at both the Chief Minister's Office and the airport," a senior police officer said

title: Like with Operation Sindoor, India can bring ‘adversary’ to talking table with fewer than 50 weapons: VCAS Tiwari
content: "I think that is an example that should be studied, and I am sure it will be studied subsequently, maybe it is too short a time since the operation..." the Vice Chief of Air Staff said

title: India looks forward to boosting ties with Maldives, committed to support capacity building: PM Modi
content: PM Modi held wide-ranging talks with Maldivian President Mohamed Muizzu and announced a ₹4,850 crore line of credit to the island nation

title: A's Kurtz becomes first rookie with 4-HR game
content: Nick Kurtz of the Athletics became the first rookie in MLB history to hit four home runs in a game, doing so in a 15-3 victory over the Astros. He also had six hits and 19 total bases.

title: Dolphins sign CB Jones after Burns' ACL injury
content: The Dolphins have signed free agent cornerback Jack Jones, making the move in the wake of Artie Burns tearing his ACL.

title: Jets QB Fields joins drills days after toe injury
content: Justin Fields took part in quarterback and 7-on-7 drills at Jets training camp Saturday, two days after suffering a dislocated toe.

title: Miami: Messi 'extremely upset' with MLS over ban
content: Inter Miami co-owner Jorge Mas said Lionel Messi is "extremely upset" after being given a one-game suspension by MLS for skipping the All-Star Game.

title: Stewart to join Bengals as rookie reaches deal
content: Shemar Stewart agreed to a four-year, fully guaranteed contract worth $18.97 million with the Bengals as he became the final first-round draft pick to reach a deal.

title: Goldschmidt regrets toss as Yanks' errors persist
content: Paul Goldschmidt's off-balance throw was the Yankees' ninth error in four games as another loss dropped them 5½ games back in the AL East.

title: Verstappen wins first sprint since Horner's exit
content: Max Verstappen kicked off Red Bull's post-Christian Horner era with an impressive sprint race victory.

title: Sources: Around 100 NFLers face SB-tix penalty
content: At least 100 players face fines and possible suspension for allegedly selling their allotted tickets to this year's Super Bowl LIX above face value, sources told ESPN.

title: 🏈 Favorite fantasy football breakouts for 2025
content: Which players can you count on to break out in 2025? Our experts go around the league and identify six that stand out.

title: Building the perfect trade deadline for the Mets and Phillies
content: New York and Philadelphia are battling for NL East domination. Here's how each can win next week's trade deadline.

title: Cameo guide: PGA stars, NFL champ, WWE icons and more
content: Nearly 30 years after the original, "Happy Gilmore 2" brings a who's who of stars from the PGA, NFL, NBA, WWE and more.

title: Return to your happy place: How Happy Gilmore's long-awaited sequel came to be
content: "Happy Gilmore 2" tees off 29 years later with sports stars, and a mission to honor the cult classic's legacy.

title: SEC preview: Alabama, Georgia, Texas, LSU ... this conference is wide open
content: The SEC never lacks for talent or storylines -- and there's no reason to think 2025 will be any different.

title: Can Florida repeat? How good will BYU be? Our men's hoops preview 100 days out
content: The Gators bolstered their roster, while the Cougars welcomed the top recruit. Here are 98 more things to know.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: "One Of The Craziest Moments Of My Life": Akhil Patel On Serving Chai To PM Modi And Starmer
content: Indian-origin tea entrepreneur Akhil Patel recounted his experience of serving tea to Narendra Modi and Keir Starmer at Chequers, calling it a “surreal” moment.

title: "Wish God Had...": Mother Who Lost Both Children In Rajasthan School Tragedy
content: Just days ago, the cheerful laughter of two siblings echoed through the courtyard of a modest house in Rajasthan's Jhalawar.

title: Karnataka Girl, 4, Found Bleeding From Private Parts; Rape Ruled Out: Cops
content: A four-year-old girl was found bleeding from her private parts after she returned from school, leading police to file a rape case against an unknown person in Karnataka's Bidar. However, the preliminary investigation has ruled out rape.

title: Hyderabad Cop Drinks Inside Police Station, Vomits, Makes Staff Clean It
content: A senior police officer in Telangana's Rachakonda has been transferred out from the commissionerate in Hyderabad for allegedly drinking alcohol in office, sources said.

title: KCR's Party Accuses Chief Minister Revanth Reddy Of Illegal Phone Surveillance
content: Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) MLA Padi Kaushik Reddy has accused Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy of orchestrating widespread illegal phone surveillance.

title: Probe Agency Raids Against Anil Ambani Firms Continue For Third Day: Report
content: ED searches against the companies of Reliance Group chairman Anil Ambani in Mumbai continued for the third day on Saturday, with the agency recovering a number of documents and computer peripherals from multiple locations, official sources said.

title: PM Modi Joins Maldives' Independence Day Celebrations As Chief Guest
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday graced the Independence Day celebrations of the Maldives as the guest of honour.

title: "Most Empathetic Voice": Neurodivergent People Find New Support In AI Tools For Social Navigation
content: For Cape Town-based filmmaker Kate D'hotman, connecting with movie audiences comes naturally. Far more daunting is speaking with others. "I've never understood how people [decipher] social cues," the 40-year-old director of horror films says.

title: "From Drug Dealer To Martyr", 2 J&K Cops Suspended For Killing Tribal Man
content: Two policemen have been suspended after killing a tribal man in an alleged staged encounter in Jammu and Kashmir. The killing of Mohammad Parvaz sparked widespread protests and outrage in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Congress Leader Says Rahul Gandhi Could Be "2nd Ambedkar", BJP Mocks Party
content: Mocking the Congress for its leader's remark that party MP and Leader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi could prove to be the "second Ambedkar" for OBCs, the BJP has termed it an insult of Dalits as well as the social reformer.

title: "It Is A Game-changing Agreement": Piyush Goyal On India-UK Free Trade Deal
content: Union Minister for Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal on Saturday termed the India-UK free trade agreement as "game-changing" and said it will benefit every section in India including farmers, youth, MSME sector and Industry.

title: India, Maldives Hit Reset, A Year After Diplomatic Ties Hit All-Time Low
content: A year after India-Maldives relations hit a historic low, the two countries appear to have reset the trajectory of their bilateral ties.

title: "Sad To Support A Regime Where...": Chirag Paswan Tears Into Nitish Kumar
content: Union Minister and Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas) President Chirag Paswan on Saturday strongly criticised the Nitish Kumar-led Bihar government over the deteriorating law and order situation in the state.

title: Karnataka Power Play Spills Over To Delhi With A 'Babu vs Babu' Clash
content: A clash between two senior Karnataka government officials stationed at Karnataka Bhavan in Delhi has triggered a political storm, amid underlying tensions between Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and his deputy, DK Shivakumar.

title: Bihar Woman Faints During Home Guard Test, Gang-Raped In Moving Ambulance
content: A 26-year-old woman participating in a Home Guard recruitment drive in Bihar's Gaya district was allegedly gang-raped in a moving ambulance while being transported to a hospital after collapsing during a physical test.

title: 5 Civilians Killed In 'Terrorist' Attack In Iran, 3 Gunmen Then Shot Dead
content: According to Alireza Daliri, deputy police commander of Sistan-Baluchistan province, the attackers attempted to enter the building disguised as visitors.

title: "PM Modi Wants To Make Cholas Global, DMK Keeping Them Local": K Annamalai To NDTV
content: K Annamalai spoke to NDTV ahead of PM Modi's visit to Tiruchirappalli to attend a mega festival to celebrate the legacy of Chola emperor Rajendra Chola I.

title: Indian Student Dies By Suicide In London, Body Brought Back To Telangana
content: The body of an Indian student in London, who died by suicide earlier this month, reportedly due to emotional distress, has been brought back to his hometown in Telangana's Mahabubabad.

title: Outrage In China After Men Share Non-Consensual Intimate Pics Of Partners On Telegram
content: Pornography in China is illegal, and conservative social attitudes towards women remain the norm, often reinforced by state media and popular culture.

content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi held a meeting with members of several political parties of the Maldives on Saturday.

title: Best of the rest: Who's left in NHL free agency?
